headline: HCA Healthcare (NYSE:HCA) Reports Earnings Growth, Completes US$6 Billion Buyback, Declares Dividend
summary: HCA Healthcare (NYSE:HCA) recently reported a strong Q1 2025 earnings performance, with sales rising to $18,321 million and net income climbing slightly to $1,610 million. This, along with the announcement of a quarterly dividend of $0.72 per share and a share buyback of over two million shares, underscores the company's focus on enhancing shareholder value. In a broader market that experienced a 4% rise amid mixed economic signals and earnings reports, HCA's 9% price increase over the past...

headline: HCA Healthcare beats profit estimates on strong demand for medical care
summary: Health insurance bellwether UnitedHealth Group last week flagged a surge in demand for medical care, particularly from older people, and lowered its annual outlook, a sign that the trend would continue this year.  HCA's first-quarter profit jumped nearly 9% to $6.45 per share, above analysts' average estimate of $5.76 per share, according to data compiled by LSEG.  HCA reiterated its annual profit forecast of $24.05 to $25.85 per share, and said it includes the current and future impacts of policy developments, including the Trump administration's tariffs on imports.

HCA reiterated its annual profit forecast of $24.05 to $25.85 per share, and said it includes the current and future impacts of policy developments, including the Trump administration's tariffs on imports.

headline: HCA Healthcare’s (NYSE:HCA) Q1 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Hospital operator HCA Healthcare (NYSE:HCA) reported Q1 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.7% year on year to $18.32 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $74.3 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $6.45 per share was 11.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: HCA: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Nashville, Tennessee-based company said it had profit of $6.45. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.77 per share.
